dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4033 IH: Nutrition Administration Assistance Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Leger Fernandez (for herself and Ms. Stansbury) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To provide additional funds to States for administration of certain nutrition programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nutrition Administration Assistance Act of 2023.

subsection.text: In addition to funds otherwise made available to State agencies to pay administration costs incurred by State agencies to carry out section 5 of the Agriculture and Consumer Protection Act of 1973 (7 U.S.C. 612c note), 70 percent of the funds appropriated under section 3 shall be provided to States for such administration costs.

In addition to funds otherwise made available to States to pay administration costs incurred by States to carry out State plans under section 203A of the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7503), 20 percent of the funds appropriated under section 3 shall be provided to States for such administration costs.

In addition to funds otherwise made available to the Secretary of Agriculture for administration costs to carry out section 4402 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 3007), 10 percent of the funds appropriated under section 3 shall be provided to States for such administration costs.

section.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act $1,000,000 for each of the fiscal years 2024 through 2028.
